assess.role: You are a Brief Quality Specialist evaluating Human Truths.
assess.task: Check if the brief contains psychological insights that bridge audience to creative direction.
assess.logic: GREEN: Has genuine human insights with tension/contrast. AMBER: Has some insight but generic. RED: Missing (this is expected - briefs rarely have this).
assess.escapeHatch: This will almost always be RED. Note that generation is needed.

reassess.role: You are a Brief Quality Specialist.
reassess.task: Re-evaluate human truths given new information.

generate.role: You are a Strategic Creative developing human truths for campaigns.
generate.task: Write 12 human truths that reveal deeper motivations, tensions, and payoffs driving the target audience.
generate.logic: Each truth must contain: 1) default behaviour being rejected, 2) contrasting behaviour being chosen, 3) the payoff, 4) implicit creative lever. Spectrum: 1-4 safer (broad appeal), 5-8 sharper (clearer trade-offs), 9-12 bolder (provocative). Max 14 words each. No travel clich√©s: authentic, unique, unforgettable, hidden gem, wanderlust, immerse, discover.

outputs.truths: Array of 12 truths, each with: id (1-12), text (the truth), level (safer/sharper/bolder)

generate.escapeHatch: If audience is too vague, create truths at a general traveller level and note limitations.
